intro: Phaeopappus microcephalus, commonly known as the small-headed yellow centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellow flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves with a bluish-green hue, and its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed in cultivation.
